dcterms:description: GDELT is an international relations dataset consisting of country-to-country interaction events of the form a country took action toward country j at time t, extracted from news corpora. It includes five count matrices, one for each year from 2001 through 2005, with around 9,000 unique word types and 3 to 6 million events for each matrix.
dcterms:title: Global Database of Events, Language, and Tone (GDELT)

dcterms:description: ICEWS is another international relations event dataset extracted from news corpora, containing fewer events compared to GDELT. It includes three count matrices for the years 2001-2003, 2004-2006, and 2007-2009, with around 3,000 unique word types and 1.3 to 1.5 million events for each matrix.
dcterms:title: Integrated Crisis Early Warning System (ICEWS)

dcterms:description: The SOTU corpus contains the text of the annual SOTU speech transcripts from 1790 through 2014, resulting in a single count matrix with 225 time steps, 7,518 unique word types, and 656,949 tokens.
dcterms:title: State-of-the-Union transcripts (SOTU)

dcterms:description: DBLP is a database of computer science research papers, specifically the subset used to evaluate GP-DPFA, consisting of a count matrix with 14 columns, 1,771 unique word types, and 13,431 tokens.
dcterms:title: DBLP conference abstracts

dcterms:description: The NIPS corpus contains the text of every NIPS conference paper from 1987 to 2003, resulting in a single count matrix with one column per year, treating unique word types as features and discarding stopwords, with 17,836 unique word types and 3.1 million tokens.
dcterms:title: NIPS corpus
